title: Stop Firefox-generated notifications?
content: I felt forced to update bc of the recent RCE. And what do you know, all sorts of unnecessary crud has been added that I've now had to turn off. But I can't figure out how to turn off the Firefox-specific notifications. NOT WEBSITES. There's nothing in settings under "notification" or "tracker" and it's wholly unnecessary. There is 0 need to to pop a flashing orange desktop notification for tracker statistics. Like this is not important info, nor is it a crisis that requires a notification.
creator: tt888

title: Bookmark import
content:
I've been attempting to import my bookmarks from Chrome on Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS. When I try to use the bookmark importer, it tells me "Firefox couldnâ€™t find any programs that contain bookmark, history or password data." No problem, I exported my Chrome bookmarks to an HTML file. I go through the steps the wizard takes me through, and in the end I am greeted with a friendly "Bookmarks Imported Successfully." However, no bookmarks have actually been imported! Restarting Firefox does not help.

See attached screenshots for troubleshooting details.
creator: scievan

title: Firefox will load nothing other than "firefox sites"
content: This issue is new and I have never experienced it before. Upon trying to open anything in a new tab, firefox gets completely stuck loading the site, and when refreshed, does the tab becomes "dead" and nothing can be entered or clicked on, even after minutes. I know it is not my internet connection, as other browsers such as opera and edge work, as well as my ability to download games from steam, and firefox is also up to date as shown by the settings page, but firefox does not allow anything to be opened or viewed other than the settings page, which I used to navigate to the support page. I could not even use "continue with google" as a method of signing in and needed to manually enter everything.
creator: thebigdumb

title: No sound on Firefox
content: Cannot play sounds (videos) on Firefox. Can on other browsers. Went through suggested solutions, nothing worked. Firefox recently sent out an update. I downloaded it, didn't change anything.
creator: Gator5

title: Since I installed Firefox, I am having problems signing on sights. I keep getting message 'Site is not secure'
content:
I need to know (in layman's language) how to fix the sight connection problem. For example: I try to connect to Google.ca. Firefox comes back saying this site is not secure. Use HTTPS. This is where it is so confusing. I am sure that the Google site is a secure sight. So why does Firefox keeps rejecting me. It can become very frustrating really.

Thank you.

ps. I am willing to read and learn
creator: sammie5514

title: Working on my Website using Firefox. The layout of all my pages is wrong.
content:
I publish two mediawiki sites. http://wikidelphia.org and http://othernetworks.org

Both show up just fine for other people and for me when I access them with other browsers.

My problem occurs when I use Firefox to work on OtherNetworks. I'm going to try attaching screen shots of the Main Page. The first is from a normal view of my main page taken with another browser. In this shot the graphic is on the right

The second one is the same page taken with Firefox as the browser. I can't even figure out how to describe what is wrong with that second display.

I'm wishing for someone to figure out what is going on here and tell me how to restore FireFox so I can use it to work on my website. Is there some setting in Firefox or in the OtherNetworks site that is causing the awkward layout when using Firefox. I'm rather dependent on the bookmarks in Firefox.

Please call me or write if you would like to help me.

Stan Pokras in Philadelphia, PA 267-968-0407
creator: stan68

title: Account Login Very Strange Behavior
content:
I recently updated to Firefox 131.0.3, having signed out of my Firefox/Mozilla account. Now I am trying to sign back in. After a seemingly successful sign-in (with email and pw, followed by "authorization code"), I'm taken to my account page. Scrolling down to Connected Services, I can see a recognizable account name (my Windows 11 user name and the name I've assigned to my computer). But looking up at the account button at the top right of Firefox, I see a small yellow triangle. Clicking on the button, I'm told "Account disconnected." (Remember, I'm currently looking at my account page, which says I'm connected.)

So I try to log in again. I give email address and password, and authorization code, and I'm in again. Now I see an addtional account connected, "Firefox 131, Windows 10" (remember, I'm using Windows 11).

So looking up again to the upper right at the account button, I see the yellow triangle, and clicking tells me once more that I'm disconnected, even though I have my account page open in front of me.

All of this, of course, prevents me from having access to the sync function. I've been through this circle several times with the same strange results.

Anyone have any idea what' going on.

Screenshot attached.

Thanks! Lance
creator: LNEL108
